cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest, expected to cross the northeastern Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night and then move north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-western Gulf Coast (TX/LA) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southwestern Louisiana / upper Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula Saturday, then entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi early next week
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty squalls possible Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge under 2 ft possible on east-facing shores if track shifts east
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain possible Tue–Wed with 2–4 in totals; localized flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Port may experience brief closures, river level rises, and delays to vessel traffic due to precautionary safety zones
